poem:
Title: "Beyond the Roast"

In Sherburn's quiet, December sighs,
A solstice dance gains new disguise.
Turkey, traditions, unknotted, laid bare,
Bellamy Christmas, challenging the fare.

Heirs of laurels, scattered across the lea,
In pursuits of love, they break distance's decree.
A reborn joy in the simple feast,
The crackling hearth hosts human geste.
